entities.name: centaur
entities.description: A creature with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse. (Introduced in the text as 'THE CENTAUR AND THE SNEAK')

entities.name: firenze
entities.description: A centaur who is calm and wise. (Introduced in the text as 'Firenze calmly said...')

entities.name: parvati
entities.description: A human who is hurt and indignant. (Introduced in the text as 'Parvati's hand fell limply to her side.')

entities.name: professor trelawney
entities.description: A human who is a fortune-teller. (Introduced in the text as 'Professor Trelawney —' began Parvati...')

relationships.description: Firenze scolds Parvati for her hurt and indignant voice. (Introduced in the text as '“Trivial hurts, tiny human accidents,” said Firenze...')
Firenze criticizes Professor Trelawney for her fortune-telling. (Introduced in the text as '“Sibyll Trelawney may have Seen, I do not know,” continued Firenze...')
